abstract: Newark schools superintendent Cami Anderson resigns after often stormy four-year tenure; Anderson, adviser and longtime friend to former New Jersey Mayor Cory A Booker and appointed by Gov Chris Christie, alienated many parents with her reorganization plan, One Newark, which ultimately led to school closings, mass firings of teachers and principals and more students in charter schools.
lead_paragraph: Ms. Anderson, who oversaw the New Jersey city’s troubled public school system, had feuded openly with the mayor, teachers and many parents.

headline.main: Cami Anderson, Picked by Christie, Is Out as Newark Schools Superintendent
headline.print_headline: Newark Schools Chief, Picked by Christie, Is Out

snippet: Ms. Anderson, who oversaw the New Jersey city’s troubled public school system, had feuded openly with the mayor, teachers and many parents.
